body: Hi! I keep experiencing a problem that disappears after I turn off multiple CPU´s. A DF calculation with simple geometry. It seems as if the analysis points that get routed to the different cores somehow acquire different settings/are calculated differently. Appears at random “rows” of points, sometimes it all works fine, so I need to do a series for the error to show. See images below. In the Ladybug fly run the VT of the window changes. It’s taken me a day and a half to track this error down. Phew. I get the same error on two different comps. What is causing this? Does anyone get the same error? Images below created with  RADquality set to 2, and 7 cores. Fiddling with Radsettings dont help, I think, except error goes away with very low ab. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/r-deMYADSbo3pFRVSl4dmYPtbTfv9TTz3x4p9rGfF9Qm8qNDWoq6IhRhaI2hOspcBUKvYUZEdhmjnhlOnlG3CQtCzkuVwpY6/stortransmittans0.45q2gsize2.0_Topstor.png)[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/r-deMYADSbrHIqPu9jlChmzEAYfq6lxxKzI9Tx9BIKUrRjnXCp*13XnU-vq5lppXIEav6NMkz14TyabiVXNz-UDhrpHEpGS8/stortransmittans0.55q2gsize2.0_Topstor.png) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/Qhk3-LcC9fheDZvJ2ZpIZsy2oW7bc7z2AGUZekqdAM3encGStranJasc*EwlAHmcBSiaOt4WT8jiFRL8TczbA5ACQ5D2eIVI/stortransmittans0.50q2gsize2.0_Topstor.png)

replies.body: Ooh, I forgot to internalize geometry. Here is the new def.

I posted this on github instead. 



[https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/honeybee/issues/647](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/honeybee/issues/647)
Ran your definition, didn't get the error you mentioned though. The results I got more or less seems to make sense (not a daylight expert).
Ok, cool, good advice should I need the speed of multiple cpu´s. For now I´m very happy using a single core setup though.
